facts: It's 1250 BC, Achilles is a mighty warrior in Greece, he has fought many times for King Agamemnon, who is uniting the Greek kingdoms.
Achilles has always battle in fights between different Greek kingdoms, but he has never fought against the Trojans, nor he has any quarrel with them.
Odysseus is the king of Ithaca, a small island in Greece, he is known for his cunning and intelligence.
Odysseus is a good friend of Achilles, one of the few he has.
Patroclus is Achilles's dear younger cousin.
Patroclus parents died when he was young, and Achilles has taken care of him since then.
Prince Hector of Troy and his brother Paris were negotiating a peace treaty with Menelaus, King of Sparta and brother of Agamemnon.
Paris has an affair with Menelaus' wife, Queen Helen, and he had smuggled her aboard his home-bound vessel.
Menelaus is furious and demanded that his brother Agamemnon help him get his wife back.
Agamemnon called all the Greek kingdoms to help them fight against Troy.
Achilles is known to be the best warrior in Greece.
Ajax is another great warrior, known for his strength.
Prince Hector is the best warrior in Troy.
Patroclus and Odysseus haven't met before.
Agamemnon has sent Odysseus to talk to Achilles and convince him to fight for the Greeks.
Odysseus knows that The Greeks are assembling the biggest fleet ever to sail to Troy.
Odysseus knows that All great warriors from Greece are going to fight in Troy, only Achilles remains undecided.
Odysseus knows that The Greek fleet parts in three days.
Odysseus knows that Agamemnon and Achilles have a long history of disagreements.
Odysseus knows that Achilles is very temperamental but wants to be forever remembered as an invincible warrior.
Odysseus knew Patroclus parents and was a friend of them as well.
The scene is set in the ruins of an ivy-covered temple on a cliff above the sea, where Achilles is sparring with his cousin Patroclus.
The temple is surrounded by a small forest of olive trees. It is morning time.
Both men wield wooden practice swords. Achilles is teaching some combat lessons to his young cousin.
The scene starts with Achilles and Patroclus sparring.
There are some spears next to where they are training.
Odysseus arrives on horseback, accompanied by a small group of soldiers.

Achilles' foot curls around the wood shaft of one of the spears lying on the ground. In one impossibly fast motion, he flips the spear into the air with his foot, catches it, and throws in the opposite direction from where he was looking. The spear lands right next to the group of warriors that just arrived.
Most warriors raise shields confused and alerted, they stay behind, but Odysseus approaches while laughs friendly.
comm_style: Achilles expects Agamemnon making a move to lure him to fight the Trojans, but he thinks the King of Kings is too proud to beg to Achilles.
Achilles despise Agamemnon. He believes that Agamemnon is not showing him the respect and recognition he deserves.
Achilles is hungry for glory. His deepest desire is to be remembered as the best warrior that ever existed.
Achilles is sick of fighting for Agamemnon, he doesn't want to keep being his mercenary.
Achilles wants protect Patroclus from any danger.
Achilles boats and brags, he would not let anyone believe there is a better warrior than him.
Achilles is very temperamental, he can get angry easily.
Achilles likes to taunt.
Achilles is full of pride and self-confidence.
Achilles is defiant and rebellious.
Achilles is well-educated, he can talk politely.
Odysseus is a master of diplomacy, he is very persuasive.
Odysseus is very intelligent and cunning.
Odysseus is a good friend of Achilles, he knows how to talk to him.
Odysseus wants to convince Achilles to fight in Troy.
Patroclus wants to be a great warrior like his cousin Achilles
Patroclus won't dare to question Achilles.
Patroclus has a strong sense of honor and want to help the Greeks.
Patroclus is a fan of great Greek warriors.
Patroclus is very young and naive.
goals: Odysseus should try to persuade Achilles to fight in Troy without prompting him to anger.
Achilles evidences his discomfort about fighting for Agamemnon.
Achilles does not disclose any decision about fighting in Troy.
